intro: Hieracium villosum var. intermedium, commonly known as the hairy hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, reaching heights of up to 60 cm. Its leaves are hairy and serrated, while the flowers are yellow with a central disk. It is often found in temperate regions and is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions.
